page.title: 19Stebbings History
page.content: The sites of 3 Roman villas have been found in Stebbing,and a Roman cemetery with 40 skeletons.Stebbing was a Saxon village and we think its name comes from Stybbinga meaning meadow of Stybba.Before the Norman Conquest the village was owned by a Saxon thegn called Siward.The Domesday record is complete for Stebbing.There were two manors.Henry de Ferrers was given Stebbing Park and Ralph Peverell settled where Parsonage Farm is now. One member of the Ferrers family served on the Domesday Commission. There was a mill,probably where Town Mill stands today.The church and the manor at Parsonage Farm were given to the Knights Hospitallers of St.John of Jerusalem and were a monastery until the Dissolution.Stebbing is a conservation area.
